topics.body: Apparently I was wrong about cheetahs; they use their tails to turn.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5593aff8636872209d00151d#post_5593aff8636872209d00151d
The problems with cheetahs is their stamina. While the gazelle might not have that rocket-fast speed they can however outlast the cheetah if they keep the chase long enough.
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
I need to learn how to properly handle fuck ups
I can only imagine how distraught I'd be if I actually fucked up something important.
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5593b17663687247c90028ae#post_5593b17663687247c90028ae
Things tend to have a margin of error. I tend to fill my thoughts on how to fix it so there's no room for crying over spilled milk. 

Basically,
"Oops, no time to feel sorry. Got to think of a way to fix this."
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5593b2696368721a75001e69#post_5593b2696368721a75001e69
see, my head goes to the territory of "YOU FUCKED UP! JUST LIKE ALL THE OTHER TIMES YOU FUCKED UP ! NO ONE CAN TRUST YOU WITH ANYTHIIIIIIING" 



that's probably unhealthy.
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5593b31b63687259f1000106#post_5593b31b63687259f1000106
I don't ever get thought like that. 

"You mess things up. What are you standing there feeling sorry for yourself for? Go and fix it!"
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5593b31b63687259f1000106#post_5593b31b63687259f1000106
Get therapy

or drink until the thoughts go away
